1349466710831734793.text: Today, I spoke on the House floor for the first time to oppose the impeachment of President Trump. Watch my speech here. Like, and retweet below. https://t.co/PfW5UZp8dJ

1349442210786402309.text: This impeachment effort ignored the normal procedure of allowing the President’s team a chance to defend him through hearings. I wish Speaker Pelosi had exercised the urgency she’s used in bringing this vote to the floor on negotiating COVID relief with Republicans last fall.

1349432573030780940.text: Instead of further dividing our country, we should be focusing on a peaceful transition of power and on the many issues that need immediate solutions, not on impeaching a President who has one week left in office.

1349424196582060032.text: I strongly oppose today’s vote to impeach President Trump. Impeachment is not the appropriate response to last week’s inexcusable violence. It only serves to deepen the divide in our country and distract from the pressing issues facing all Americans.

1349385156109467649.text: Thank you @SteveScalise for this great op-ed. I agree, we all must always condemn political violence and violent rhetoric, and not just when it fits our politics. Both the riots over the summer and the attack on the Capitol last week were wrong. https://t.co/GQqQCZloxA

1349087005641232384.text: I strongly oppose measures to invoke the 25th Amendment and impeach President Trump. Read my full statement below: https://t.co/4uW0dpyXru

1349031076811976705.text: Yesterday I met with Jerry Caldwell, General Manager @BMSupdates. We discussed this year’s plan for races & programs, and how BMS donated space to the Sullivan County Health Dept. for COVID vaccine administration. I will do all I can to make sure we can safely enjoy races soon. https://t.co/82KdJHJN2R

1348758588051890187.text: Today I visited the Sullivan County Health Department’s vaccine distribution at the Bristol Dragway where 1,000 doses were being distributed today. Thank you to everyone who is working to make sure East Tennesseans receive their COVID vaccine. https://t.co/Bh7d5ZdbI6

1348715741739184130.text: I’m proudly displaying this sign at my office to show my gratitude to the brave men and women of the U.S. Capitol Police. These heroes’ actions last week saved many lives. God bless them and their loved ones. https://t.co/hZ1sk3DyoQ

1348687646986526721.text: It was great to virtually meet with Erwin Alderman Baker and Unicoi County Mayor Evely. Thank you both for your leadership and I look forward to serving the people of Unicoi County alongside you. https://t.co/KA5Fd6Tg5Y

1347938219829178369.text: Thank you to all of the brave officers in law enforcement for your service and for protecting us. Now more than ever, we need to stand by our men and women in blue. May God bless you all! https://t.co/Un6Gn5r6Js

1347692238252486656.text: Twitter’s permanent suspension of President Trump is beyond disturbing. Instead of fostering open debate, this move will deepen the divide in this country. Unacceptable does not even begin to describe this move. https://t.co/Fn7LkVBKSR

1347550686762987521.text: It is heartbreaking to hear that Officer Brian Sicknick passed away following Wednesday’s senseless violence. May God bless him and his family. Please join me in praying for his loved ones and for all of our brave law enforcement officers.

1347305136159420417.text: Twitter thinks it’s ok to ban @realDonaldTrump but allows this tweet from Iran’s supreme leader that’s clearly inciting violence against America to stand? This is not acceptable! https://t.co/dkz3YQNEUv

1347223706523889666.text: Sadly, this is just the latest example of big tech silencing conservatives. This is unacceptable and should not happen. Our society thrives when all opinions are heard and debated, not when many are silenced.

1347223482795520010.text: Big tech should not censor the leader of the free world and restrict his ability to communicate directly to the American people, especially during a critical moment in our nation such as right now. Facebook and Twitter should restore @realDonaldTrump’s accounts immediately!

1346958948914626562.text: And to the brave men and women in the Capitol Police who protected us today- God bless you all, and thank you for your service. (3/3)

1346958760800002049.text: To my fellow Americans who are frustrated with the election results, we must let the objection process play out peacefully. We must never resort to violence to accomplish our objectives- that is contrary to how we do things in America. (2/3)

1346958382054449153.text: Every American has the right to peacefully protest. What happened today was unacceptable. Those who broke into the Capitol and attacked our law enforcement should face the full consequences of the law. (1/3)

1346913075144790018.text: As Americans, we are better than the violence occurring today on Capitol Hill. We all have our first amendment right to peacefully protest the certification of election results, and should exercise it when warranted. Violence like this is never acceptable
